message.content:
**1)  Description of the Target Image**

There are two separate “buildings” in the scene:

• **Left‐hand Building**  
  – **Total of 8 blocks** arranged in four main “levels.”  
  – **Bottom Layer:** Two red arch‐shaped supports (one on the far left, one on the far right) and a red arch block bridging across the center.  
  – **Second Layer:** A long, yellow rectangular plank running horizontally on top of the arches.  
  – **Third Layer:** A small yellow rectangular block set in the middle, with a red cube resting above it.  
  – **Top (Roof) Layer:** Two orange triangular wedges meeting at the peak to form a roof.  

• **Right‐hand Building**  
  – **Total of 6 blocks** arranged in three main vertical levels.  
  – **Center Tower:** Two green cubes stacked one atop the other.  
  – **Base Triangles (Left/Right):** One orange triangular wedge on each side at the bottom of the tower.  
  – **Roof Triangles:** A pair of orange triangular wedges meeting on top to form a pointed roof.

In total, there are 14 blocks used across the two structures.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**2)  Selecting the Required Blocks From the Dictionary**

Below is the exact list of dictionary blocks (by index) needed.  Note that some blocks appear multiple times (e.g., three copies of block #2 for the arches, two copies of block #7 for the green cubes, etc.).  These must all be used in **exactly** the orientation shown in the dictionary image (no re‐orienting):

• **Red Arch Block (#2):** 3 copies  
• **Red Cube (#8):** 1 copy  

• **Yellow Small Rectangular Block (#9):** 1 copy  
• **Yellow Long Plank (#10):** 1 copy  

• **Green Cube (#7):** 2 copies  

• **Orange Triangular Wedges** (used in pairs to form roofs or base supports):  
   – #13: 2 copies total  
   – #14: 2 copies total  
   – #15: 1 copy  
   – #16: 1 copy  

(This yields 14 total pieces in the same orientation shown in the dictionary.)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**3)  Step‐by‐Step Assembly Order**

Below is one possible sequence building from the ground up.  The first eight steps assemble the left‐hand building; the final steps assemble the right‐hand building.

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 2   (left bottom arch)  
  Step2:  Move block with index 2   (right bottom arch)  
  Step3:  Move block with index 2   (center arch bridging the first two)  
  Step4:  Move block with index 10  (long yellow plank across arches)  
  Step5:  Move block with index 9   (small yellow rectangular block in center)  
  Step6:  Move block with index 8   (red cube atop the yellow block)  
  Step7:  Move block with index 13  (left orange roof wedge)  
  Step8:  Move block with index 14  (right orange roof wedge)  

  Step9:  Move block with index 7   (bottom green cube for right tower)  
  Step10: Move block with index 7   (second green cube stacked above)  
  Step11: Move block with index 15  (orange triangular wedge at bottom left)  
  Step12: Move block with index 16  (orange triangular wedge at bottom right)  
  Step13: Move block with index 13  (top orange wedge, left side of roof)  
  Step14: Move block with index 14  (top orange wedge, right side of roof)  
}

Following these steps (and reusing indices exactly as listed) reproduces the target layout as shown.
